speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: SCENE IV. The palace yard.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Noise and tumult within. Enter Porter and his Man

speaker: Porter
text_entry: You'll leave your noise anon, ye rascals: do you

speaker: Porter
text_entry: take the court for Paris-garden? ye rude slaves,

speaker: Porter
text_entry: leave your gaping.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Within

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Good master porter, I belong to the larder.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Belong to the gallows, and be hanged, ye rogue! is

speaker: Porter
text_entry: this a place to roar in? Fetch me a dozen crab-tree

speaker: Porter
text_entry: staves, and strong ones: these are but switches to

speaker: Porter
text_entry: 'em. I'll scratch your heads: you must be seeing

speaker: Porter
text_entry: christenings? do you look for ale and cakes here,

speaker: Porter
text_entry: you rude rascals?

speaker: Man
text_entry: Pray, sir, be patient: 'tis as much impossible--

speaker: Man
text_entry: Unless we sweep 'em from the door with cannons--

speaker: Man
text_entry: To scatter 'em, as 'tis to make 'em sleep

speaker: Man
text_entry: On May-day morning; which will never be:

speaker: Man
text_entry: We may as well push against Powle's, as stir em.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: How got they in, and be hang'd?

speaker: Man
text_entry: Alas, I know not; how gets the tide in?

speaker: Man
text_entry: As much as one sound cudgel of four foot--

speaker: Man
text_entry: You see the poor remainder--could distribute,

speaker: Man
text_entry: I made no spare, sir.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: You did nothing, sir.

speaker: Man
text_entry: I am not Samson, nor Sir Guy, nor Colbrand,

speaker: Man
text_entry: To mow 'em down before me: but if I spared any

speaker: Man
text_entry: That had a head to hit, either young or old,

speaker: Man
text_entry: He or she, cuckold or cuckold-maker,

speaker: Man
text_entry: Let me ne'er hope to see a chine again

speaker: Man
text_entry: And that I would not for a cow, God save her!

speaker: Man
text_entry: Within

speaker: Man
text_entry: Do you hear, master porter?

speaker: Porter
text_entry: I shall be with you presently, good master puppy.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Keep the door close, sirrah.

speaker: Man
text_entry: What would you have me do?

speaker: Porter
text_entry: What should you do, but knock 'em down by the

speaker: Porter
text_entry: dozens? Is this Moorfields to muster in? or have

speaker: Porter
text_entry: we some strange Indian with the great tool come to

speaker: Porter
text_entry: court, the women so besiege us? Bless me, what a

speaker: Porter
text_entry: fry of fornication is at door! On my Christian

speaker: Porter
text_entry: conscience, this one christening will beget a

speaker: Porter
text_entry: thousand; here will be father, godfather, and all together.

speaker: Man
text_entry: The spoons will be the bigger, sir. There is a

speaker: Man
text_entry: fellow somewhat near the door, he should be a

speaker: Man
text_entry: brazier by his face, for, o' my conscience, twenty

speaker: Man
text_entry: of the dog-days now reign in's nose; all that stand

speaker: Man
text_entry: about him are under the line, they need no other

speaker: Man
text_entry: penance: that fire-drake did I hit three times on

speaker: Man
text_entry: the head, and three times was his nose discharged

speaker: Man
text_entry: against me; he stands there, like a mortar-piece, to

speaker: Man
text_entry: blow us. There was a haberdasher's wife of small

speaker: Man
text_entry: wit near him, that railed upon me till her pinked

speaker: Man
text_entry: porringer fell off her head, for kindling such a

speaker: Man
text_entry: combustion in the state. I missed the meteor once,

speaker: Man
text_entry: and hit that woman; who cried out 'Clubs!' when I

speaker: Man
text_entry: might see from far some forty truncheoners draw to

speaker: Man
text_entry: her succor, which were the hope o' the Strand, where

speaker: Man
text_entry: she was quartered. They fell on; I made good my

speaker: Man
text_entry: place: at length they came to the broom-staff to

speaker: Man
text_entry: me; I defied 'em still: when suddenly a file of

speaker: Man
text_entry: boys behind 'em, loose shot, delivered such a shower

speaker: Man
text_entry: of pebbles, that I was fain to draw mine honour in,

speaker: Man
text_entry: and let 'em win the work: the devil was amongst

speaker: Man
text_entry: 'em, I think, surely.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: These are the youths that thunder at a playhouse,

speaker: Porter
text_entry: and fight for bitten apples; that no audience, but

speaker: Porter
text_entry: the tribulation of Tower-hill, or the limbs of

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Limehouse, their dear brothers, are able to endure.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: I have some of 'em in Limbo Patrum, and there they

speaker: Porter
text_entry: are like to dance these three days; besides the

speaker: Porter
text_entry: running banquet of two beadles that is to come.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Enter Chamberlain

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Mercy o' me, what a multitude are here!

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: They grow still too; from all parts they are coming,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: As if we kept a fair here! Where are these porters,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: These lazy knaves? Ye have made a fine hand, fellows:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: There's a trim rabble let in: are all these

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Your faithful friends o' the suburbs? We shall have

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Great store of room, no doubt, left for the ladies,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: When they pass back from the christening.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: An't please

speaker: Porter
text_entry: your honour,

speaker: Porter
text_entry: We are but men; and what so many may do,

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Not being torn a-pieces, we have done:

speaker: Porter
text_entry: An army cannot rule 'em.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: As I live,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: If the king blame me for't, I'll lay ye all

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: By the heels, and suddenly; and on your heads

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Clap round fines for neglect: ye are lazy knaves;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: And here ye lie baiting of bombards, when

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Ye should do service. Hark! the trumpets sound;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: They're come already from the christening:

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Go, break among the press, and find a way out

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: To let the troop pass fairly; or I'll find

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: A Marshalsea shall hold ye play these two months.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Make way there for the princess.

speaker: Man
text_entry: You great fellow,

speaker: Man
text_entry: Stand close up, or I'll make your head ache.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: You i' the camlet, get up o' the rail;

speaker: Porter
text_entry: I'll peck you o'er the pales else.

speaker: Porter
text_entry: Exeunt
